title: Players
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Stats page (default) OR selects Players tab
custom_expected: THEN Players stats leader row and table should load below the filters

title: Teams
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Teams tab OR selects Teams tab
custom_expected: THEN Teams stats leader row and table should load below the filters

title: Statcast > link to MDOT page for launch???
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Statcast tab OR selects Statcast tab
custom_expected: THEN Statcast player leader row and and table should load below the filters

title: Column defaults to sort in descending order
custom_steps: WHEN user views Stats table columns
custom_expected: THEN the selected columns should default to descending order

title: User can select a column header to sort in ascending order
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a column header
custom_expected: THEN the column should switch to sort from descending to ascending and vice versa

title: Player list updates to match stat order
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks a column header to update sort
custom_expected: THEN the player/team list should also update to represent the ascending/descending order

title: Selected column's stats use blue font color
custom_steps: WHEN a column is selected (or selected as a default)
custom_expected: THEN the column stats and column header should be in blue text

title: Leading Stat receives blue box treatment
custom_steps: WHEN a column is selected
custom_expected: THEN the leading stat (highest value) should have a blue box treatment. stat should be in a blue box, with number in white color.

title: Stats for other categories match respectively ranked player
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a column to sort
custom_expected: THEN all other stats should re-organize on the list to match the column

title: Hover over Column header should reveal tool tip
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers over the column header
custom_expected: THEN tool tip should be revealed to show what the Column header abbreviation stands for

title: Statcast - has column section headers
custom_steps: WHEN user selects or loads Statcast tab
custom_expected:
THEN there should be column section headers that go above column headers. 

Examples: 
Batting - Exit Velocity MPH, Home Runs, Barrels, Hit Probability %, XBA
Fielding - Catch Probability %, Sprint Speed MPH, Distance Covered FT, Arm Strength FT, Throw Distance FT

title: Player Rank (rank according to selected stat)
Player Name (Last Name is Bold and links to Player Page)
QUESTION for PM - what about Pitcher stats???
Pull in Latest Stats Totals (Player traded mid-season)
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user views a player who has been traded
custom_expected: THEN player stats should pull in total stats from both teams and not show duplicate player tables for both teams.

title: Highest Stat loaded in view should be Italicized in RED font
custom_preconds: GIVEN user views Players, Teams, Statcast
custom_steps: WHEN user views a Stat leading category
custom_expected: THEN the stat number that leads the League (highest value) should be italicized in RED font

title: IF Highest Stat is league leading it should get a diamond hex next to number
custom_preconds: GIVEN user views Players, Teams, Statcast
custom_steps: WHEN user views a stat that IS the highest value in League (League Leader)
custom_expected: THEN there should be a red diamond hex symbol next to the stat #

title: Standard - Hitting Group 1,2
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Player > Hitting > Standard
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 1: G (Games), AB (At Bats)
Group 2: R (Runs), H (Hits), 2B (Doubles), 3B (Triples), HR (Home Runs), RBI (Runs Batted In)

title: Standard - Hitting Group 4,5
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Hitting > Standard
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 3: BB (Walks), SO (Strikeouts)
Group 4: SB (Stolen Bases), CS (Caught Stealing)
Group 5: AVG (Average), OBP( On Base Percentage), SLG (Slugging Percentage), OPS (On Base + Slug Percentage)

title: Advanced - Hitting Group 1,2
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Hitting > Advanced
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 1: PA (Plate Appearances), P/PA (Pitches per Plate Appearance)
Group 2: GO (Groundouts), FO (Flyouts), GO/FO (Groundout/Flyout Ratio), SF (Sacrifice Fly), GIDP (Ground Into Double Play), XBH (Extra Base Hits)

title: Advanced - Hitting Group 3,4,5
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Hitting > Advanced
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 3: TB (Total Bases), HR/AB (Home Runs per At Bat)
Group 4: IBB (Intentional Walks), HBP (Hit by Pitch), BB/K (Walks per Strikeout), BB/PA (Walks per Plate Appearance)
Group 5: BABIP (Batting Average on Balls in Play), ISO (Isolated Power), wOBA (Weighted On-Base Average), xwOBA (Expected Weighted On-Base Average)

title: Standard - Pitching Group 1,2
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Player > Pitching > Standard
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 1: G (Games), GS (Games Started)
Group 2: IP (Innings Pitched), H (Hits), R (Runs), ER (Earned Runs), HR (Home Runs)

title: Standard - Pitching Group 4,5
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Pitching > Standard
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 3: BB (Walks), SO (Strikeouts), SO/BB (Strikeout/Walk Ratio), K/9 (Strikeouts per 9 Innings)
Group 4: W (Wins), L (Losses), S (Saves)
Group 5: WHIP (Walks & Hits per Innings Pitched), ERA (Earned Run Average)

title: Advanced - Pitching Group 1,2,3
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Pitching > Advanced
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 1: NP (Number of Pitches), TBF (Total Batters Faced), P/PA (Pitches per Plate Appearance), P/IP (Pitches per Inning Average)
Group 2: SVO (Save Opportunities), HLD (Holds)
Group 3: CG (Complete Games), SHO (Shutouts)

title: Advanced - Pitching Group 4,5
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user loads Players > Pitching > Advanced
custom_expected:
THEN
Group 4: HB (Hit Batsmen), IBB (Intentional Walks), WP (Wild Pitches), BLK (Balks)
Group 5: GIDP (Ground into Double Plays) GO (Groundouts), FO (Flyouts), GO/FO (Groundout/Flyout Ratio), SB (Stolen Bases Allowed), CS (Caught Stealing Against), PK (Pickoffs)

title: List of all Years available with Data
custom_preconds: GIVEN user views Players, Teams, Statcast
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Years filter
custom_expected: THEN filter dropdown should contain all years that is present in API data

title: NEED PRODUCT INFO - All Time by Year - Active
NEED PRODUCT INFO - All Time by Year - All Time
NEED PRODUCT INFO - All Time Totals - Active
NEED PRODUCT INFO - All Time Totals - All Time

custom_steps: WHEN user selects a team from dropdown

2. teams should be alpha sorted by city name

custom_steps: WHEN user selects Spring Training

custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads Stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the Timeframes dropdown filter
custom_expected: THEN dropdown options are: Pre All-Star, Post All-Star, Last 7, Last 30, Custom*

custom_steps: WHEN user selects MORE > Rookies
custom_expected: THEN only Rookies' stats should show in Stats section in relation to other filters

custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads stats page on a mobile device
custom_expected: THEN the "More" dropdown filter should be removed

custom_steps: WHEN user selects a Game Split filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Splits

title: Splits by Timeframe
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the Timeframes Splits filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Timeframe are
1. Timelines - Pre All-Star, Post All-Star, 7 days, 30 days, Custom*
2. Month - March (If applicable for selected season), April, May, June, July, August, September, October
3. Day - Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday

custom_steps: WHEN user selects Opponent Splits filter
custom_expected: THEN available Opponent Splits are AL & NL

title: Splits by At Bat (batter/pitcher)

custom_steps: WHEN user selects At Bat Splits filter
custom_expected:

Batting Left, Batting Right, vs LHP, vs. RHP

custom_steps: WHEN user selects Score splits filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Scores splits are
Team Ahead, Team Behind, Tied, Late/Close, In Win, In Loss, Following Win, Following Loss

title: Splits by Runners (on base)
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Runners Splits filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Runners Splits are
- Lead-off, Bases Empty (Not Leadoff), Bases Empty, Bases Loaded, 1st, 1st and 2nd, 1st and 3rd, 2nd, 2nd and 3rd, 3rd, Runner on 3rd - 2 out, Runners On, Runners On - 2 out, Scoring Position, Scoring Position - 2 out

title: Splits by Position
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Position Splits filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Position Splits are
- P, C, 1B, 2B, 3B, SS, LF, CF, RF, DH, PH

title: Splits by Inning
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Inning Splits filter
custom_expected:
THEN available Inning Splits are
- 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, Extra, 1-6, 7+, 8+, 9+

title: Splits by Count
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page
custom_steps: WHEN user selects the Count filter
custom_expected:

- each player/team name should appear under stat total #

custom_expected: THEN user be able to select and filter by MLB or AL or NL

title: Mobile Table - view controlled by stat pill filter

custom_steps: WHEN user views stats or selects on a filter pill
custom_expected:
THEN the view shows 1 stat category at a time based on pill (filter selected)

Lists all the leaders for stat selected

title: Mobile Table - display stat abbreviated & Stat full name
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page on mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads stats page and selected filter on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN table should
1. Display Stat abbreviated and Stat Full Name
2. Stat Abbreviation should be in all bold, 18px font. Font color #191919
3. Stat Full Name should not be bold. 14px font. Font color of #7d7d7d.
Ex: AVG BATTING AVERAGE

title: Mobile Table - display player (or team) name
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page on mobile device
custom_steps:
WHEN 
1. user loads the player stats page on mobile device
2. user loads the team stats page on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. Display Player Name
2. Should read as First Initial, Last Name
3. Display Team name (Boston Red Sox)

Ex: J. Saltalamacchia

title: Mobile Table - display position
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player stats page on mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads player stats page on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. Display Position
2. Font color #7d7d7d
3. Font size 16 px

title: Mobile Table - display team CID
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player stats page on mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads player stats page on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. Display Team CID
2. Font color #7d7d7d
3. Font size 16 px

ex: ATL

title: Mobile Table - display stat value
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads player stats page on mobile devices
custom_steps: WHEN user loads player stats page on mobile devices
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. Display Stat Value
2. Right aligned
3. Font Size 20px

title: Page Pagination - show "Next 25 Players" button
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats
custom_steps: WHEN user loads stats page on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN at bottom of player list, button with "Next 25 Players" or "Next X Teams" should display
- number of teams should be dynamic
- scroll placement should save when clicking "back"
- scroll placement should not save when changing filter

title: Filter modal bar select & swipe
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stat pages on mobile devices
custom_steps: WHEN user selects or swipes modal bar
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. stat modal bar should appear below table 
2. stat modal bar can be swiped to see other stats
3. stat categories can be selected

title: Filter modal bar drag ability
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads the stats page on mobile device
custom_steps:
WHEN 
1. user "drags" the modal bar "up" on mobile device
2. user "drags" the modal menu bar "down" on mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN 
1. stats modal can be "dragged up" to see all available filters in list view 
2. stats filter menu will close

title: Filter modal pills
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads the stats page on a mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads the stats page on a mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN
1. stat pill filters should be based on header filters (Players, Teams, Statcast & Hitting, Pitching, Fielding)
2. stat pills should use abbreviated stats names (AVG, HR, etc.)
3. stat pills can be selected to update table
4. AVG is default

title: ??Available filters for modal menu??
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads stats page on mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user drags up the filter modal bar
custom_expected:
THEN the following filters should be available:
1. Standard/Advanced
2. List Standard??
3. List Advanced??

title: Shared Web link to Mobile should open the sorted stat column
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads a stat page link on mobile device
custom_steps: WHEN user loads link on mobile device, that was shared from a web browser
custom_expected:
THEN main stat showed should be the column that was sorted on web browser
(ex: web = OPS sorted, mobile = OPS shown)

title: Sharing Web link with Mobile should retain set filters (& vice versa)
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads a shared stats link
custom_steps: WHEN user loads a shared stat link on mobile device or web browser
custom_expected: THEN the filters should be saved regardless of which platform opens link

title: Shared Mobile link to Web should sort by Mobile stat shown
custom_preconds: GIVEN user loads shared link on web browser
custom_steps: WHEN user loads a shared mobile device link on web browser
custom_expected: THEN the web browser stat page should sort by the whatever stat was shown on mobile

title: Year dropdown - default to Current Year
Player names should have accent marks
